1 SECTION 1
DEFINITIONS
Except as otherwise specified, the following terms as used herein and in the S
ervice
A
greement
will be construed to have the following scope and meaning:
1.1
223Btu224 means one British Thermal Unit, and shall be the quantity of heat required to raise
the temperature of one (1) pound of water, herein called H2O, from fifty
-
eight and five
-
tenths
degrees (58.5 degrees) to fifty-
nine and five
-
tenths degrees (59.5 degr
ees) Fahrenheit. 223MMBtu
mean one million (1,000,000) Btus.
1.2
223Business Day224 means any day during a year, except Saturday, Sunday or Transporter222s
holidays.
1.3
223Central Receipt Point224 means a Point(s) of Receipt on Transporter222s system where
measurement custody transfers to Transporter from
multiple wellheads upstream.
1.4
223Contract Year224 means the (12)
twelve
-
Month period beginning on the effective date of
the
S
ervice
A
greement and each subsequent
(12)
twelve
-
M
onth period thereafter during the term
of the Service A
greement.
1.5
223Evaluation Period224 means the time period between Transporter222s receipt of Shipper222s
valid request for F
irm transportation service and Shipper222s execution of a F
irm
Service A
greement.
1.6
223FERC224 or 223Commission224 means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or any
successor agency.
1.7
223Firm224 means that the capacity in Transporter222s
P
ipeline
S
ystem necessary to transport
intrastate
quantities of G
as for the account of Shipper is not no
w, and will not become, subject to
prior
claim
of
use
by any person other than Shipper
,
except as identified in Section
s
3, 7, 9,
or
11
hereof, or as specifically set forth otherwise in the applicable Service Agreement
.
1.8
223Fuel224 means the quantity of Gas for Transporter use, on Transporter222s Pipeline System.
1.9
223Gas224 means natural gas in its natural state, produced from wells, including casinghead g
as
produced with crude oil, natural gas from gas wells, and residue gas resulting from processing both
casinghead g
as and well gas.
1.10
223Gas Day224 means a period of twenty
-
four (24) consecutive hours, beginning and ending at
9:00 a.m. (Central clock time).
1.11
223Gross Heating Value224 means the number of Btu liberated by the complete combustion
with air at the constant pressure of one (1) cubic foot of G
as, at a base temperature of sixty (60)
degrees F and a reference pressure base equal to fourteen and seventy
-
three hundredths (14.73)
3 1.24
223
Service Agreement
224
shall mean any form of contract pursuant to which Transporter
provides transportation, parking
or
lending, or any other form of service to a Shipper
that utilize
the Pipeline System or any of its components, including, without limitation, backhaul
transportation, hub services and or header facility Gas movement and diversion services, and
compression services.
1.25
223Shipper224 means the party that holds all lawful rights and/or title to the Gas that is being
transported, parked or loaned a
nd which executes a S
ervice A
greement with Transporter.
1.26
223
Thermally
E
quivalent
224
shall mean various quantities of Gas, each having equal heating
value, expressed in Btu and measured under the specifications and conditions contained here
in
.

223Trans
porter224 means DCP
Guadalupe Pipeline, LLC
.
SECTION 2
OPERATING PROVISIONS
2.1
Transporter is an intrastate pipeline
operating in the state of Texas
and is a gas utility
subject to jurisdiction of the R
CT
. Transporter performs a 223merchant function224 and predominantly
engages in the purchase and sale of Gas on its pipeline
system
in the state of Texas. Transportation
services are offered on an intrast
ate
basis
and
interstate basis (under Section 311(a)(2) of the
NGPA, or 223NGPA Section 311224) pursuant to the terms of this Statement of Operating Conditions.
2.2
Firm Transportation Service
.
Firm Transportation Service is offered by Transporter for intrastate transportation services
.
Subject to the operating conditions and definitions contained
herein,
when supplying
intrastate
Firm transportation services
,
Transporter shall receive from
Shipper such daily quantities of Gas as are timely nominated by
Shipper and scheduled by
Transporter pursuant to Section 20, up to Shipper222s MDQ as specified in the applicable
executed
F
irm
S
ervice
A
greement, plus the required quantity of Gas for Fuel and Lost and Unaccounted
For,
when required by the Service Agreemen
t
.
Transporter shall then, on a Firm b
asis, deliver
Gas, up to the MDQ to the timely nominated Point(s) of Delivery.
2.3
Interruptible Transportation Service
.
Interruptible Transportation Service is offered by Transporter for intrastate and NGPA Section 311 services. Subject to the operating conditions and
definitions
contained herein, when supplying
Interruptible transportation service, Transporter shall
recei
ve from Shipper such daily quantities of Gas as are timely nominated by Shipper and
scheduled by Transporter pursuant to Section 20, up to Shipper222s MDQ, if applicable, as specified
in the applicable executed
S
ervice
A
greement, plus the required quantity of Gas for Fuel and Lost
and Unaccounted For, when required by the Service Agreement. Transporter shall then, on an
Interruptible basis, deliver Gas, up to the MDQ to the timely nominated Point(s) of Delivery.
2.4
Parking Service
.
Parking Service is offe
red by Transporter for intrastate and NGPA Section 311 services. Subject to the operating conditions contained herein, Shipper may park such
quantities of Gas as are timely nominated by Shipper and scheduled by Transporter pursuant to
Section 20 at a point on Transporter222s Pipeline System for a period up to one calendar Month, and
4 such period may be extended with Transporter222s permission. This service is Interruptible in nature,
and shall be provided to the extent Transporter222s Pipeline System permits the
provision of such
service and to the extent Transporter determines the provision of such shall not prevent Transporter
from meeting all of its merchant functions and Firm and Interruptible transportation obligations,
including Transporter222s Pipeline Syste
m needs. Parking Service shall be subject to curtailment or
interruption as provided in Sections 3, 7, 9, and 11 of this Statement of Operating Conditions.
2.4
Lending Service
.
Lending Service is offered by Transporter for intrastate and NGPA Section 311 services. Subject to operating conditions contained herein, Transporter may advance
(loan) to Shipper such quantities of Gas as are timely nominated by Shipper and scheduled by
Transporter for a period up to one calendar Month, and such period may be extended with
T
ransporter222s permission. The service is Interruptible in nature, and shall be provided to the extent
Transporter222s Pipeline System permits the provision of such service and to the extent Transporter
determines the provision for such service shall not prevent Transporter from meeting all of
merchant functions and its Firm and Interruptible transportation obligations, including
Transporter222s Pipeline System needs. Lending Service shall be subject to curtailment or
interruption as provided in Sections 3, 7, 9
and 11
of this Statement of Operating Conditions.
Shipper and Transporter, at the time such advances are scheduled, will agree to a redelivery (return
of loaned Gas) schedule setting out the dates and daily quantities of Gas Shipper will redeliver to
Tra
nsporter, at the point at which Gas was advanced, to reduce Shipper222s lending account to zero.
If Shipper fails to redeliver quantities of Gas as set out in the redelivery schedule, Shipper shall be
obligated to purchase such quantities of Gas from Transporter at the highest price, determined as
200% of the Monthly Contract Index for the Index as published in Gas Daily, or similar publication
if Gas Daily is unavailable, that is the closest in proximity to the point at which Gas was advanced,
during: a) the Month in which the lending service occurred, b) the Month in which redelivery of
the lending service was scheduled but did not occur, and; c) any Month between (a) and (b) above.
SECTION 3
GOVERNING LAW, REGULATIONS AND TAXES
3.1
The interpretation and performance of the Service Agreement shall be governed by,
construed, interpreted and enforced in accordance with the substantive laws of the State of Texas,
without reference to its choice of law doctrine. Transporter222s transportation services are su
bject
to all present and future valid lawful orders of all regulatory authorities now or hereafter having
jurisdiction of the services or facilities used to provide such services
. Transporter222s NGPA Section
311
transportation services are subject to
the p
rovisions of Subpart C of Part 284 of the
Commission222s Regulations. Should Shipper or Transporter, by force of any such law or regulation
imposed at any time during the term of Shipper222s
S
ervice A
greement, be rendered unable, wholly
or in part, to carry out its obligations under the S
ervice
A
greement, other than to make payments
due under
the applicable Service Agreement
, the
S
ervice
A
greement nevertheless shall continue
and shall be deemed modifie
d to conform with the requirements of such law or regulation, except
as hereinafter provided. The S
ervice
A
greement shall be modified to the least extent necessary to
conform to such requirements; the primary intent of any such modification being to retain, to the
greatest extent possible, the bargain of the Shipper222s S
ervice
A
greement. The S
ervice
A
greement
is expressly made subject to any and all tariff and other rate filings made by Transporter and
6 potential
S
hipper222s request for S
ervice
A
greement shall be considered complete only if the
information specified in Section 4.2 is provided in writing.
Requests fo
r service shall be sent to:
DCP
Guadalupe Pipeline, LLC
2107 City West Blvd
Suite 600
Houston, TX 77042
Attention: Director Marketing 226 Guadalupe Pipeline
4.2
Each request for service shall include the following information:
4.2.1
Potential
S
hipper222s name, address, representative, telephone number, fax number
and email address, if available.
4.2.2
For NGPA Section 311 transportation service, a statement indicating the 223on behalf
of224 entity that Shipper warrants meets the provisions of Section 284 of t
he Commission222s
regulations
and of Section 26.2 below
.
4.2.3
For Texas Intrastate transportation service, such proof as Transporter may
reasonably require that the Gas to be transported will meet the Intrastate warranty
requirements
, including those set forth in Section 26.1 below
.
4.2.4
Type of service requested: Firm transportation, Interruptible transportation,
Parking, or Lending.
4.2.5
Point(s) of Receipt and Point(s) of Delivery for all services.
4.2.6
MDQ for the requested S
ervice A
greement.
4.2.7
Price offered by potential S
hipper for the service requested (Dollars per MMBtu
for Interruptible transportation service and Parking and Lending service; reservation charge
in Dollars per MMBtu per Day and us
age charge in Dollars per MMBtu for Firm
transportation service
).
4.2.8
Term of S
ervice
A
greement, including the date service is requested to commence
and the date service is requested to terminate.
4.3
Unless waived by Transporter, requests for transpor
tation service will be invalid and will
not be considered if a Transportation Agreement is not entered into within forty-
five (45) days of
the date of receipt of the information specified in this section; provided, however, that in no event
will Transporte
r be required to perform service prior to such time that Shipper satisfies such
condition. Requests which cannot be provided due to insufficient capacity, or because of a failure
to satisfy the terms of this Statement of Operating Conditions within forty
-
five (45) days of the
8 SECTION 6
CAPACITY AVAILABLE FOR INTRASTATE FIRM TRANSPORTATION AGREEMENT
6.1
Firm
transportation
capacity that is or becomes available on Transporter222s system from
time to time shall be allocated on a net present value basis. To the extent that two (2) or more
requests for
F
irm transportation
service are received during the same Evaluation Period and
such
requests involve the same capacity, in whole or in part, then F
irm capacity will be allocated to that
request(s) generating the highest net present value to Transporter. Net present value will be
determined based on the discounted cash flow of revenues to Transporter produced, lost, or
affected by the request(s) for service. In determining the highest net present value, Transporter
will consider objective criteria only. Such criteria may include, but is not limited to, the maximum
contract quantity
requested, the term of the service requested, the offered rate, the date on which
the requested service would commence, and such other objective criteria available based on the
requests for service received by Transporter. The net present value discount factor used by
Transporter will be applied consistently to all requests for capacity within an Evaluation Period.
6.2
If
Transporter receives two (2) or more requests for F
irm transportation service which
produce an equivalent net present value, any available capacity will be allocated between or among
such requests on a pro rata basis; provided, however, if one or more party(s) is offered capacity on
a pro rata basis pursua
nt to this Section and any party declines to contract for such capacity, such
party222s request shall be deemed null and void and the available capacity will be reallocated among
such remaining requests which produced equivalent net present values.
6.3
To
the extent Transporter has available unsubscribed
F
irm
transportation
capacity,
Transporter reserves the right, but shall not be obligated, to reserve such capacity for a future
expansion project provided that any such project is completed by the later of one (1) year from the
date Transporter deems such capacity reserved or the date such reserved capacity actually becomes
available for use.
6.4
If, during any ninety (90) day period subsequent to the service commencement date, the
daily average of Shipper222
s deliveries of G
as under
its F
irm
Service A
greement during such period
is less than seventy
-
five percent (75%) of the MDQ for such F
irm
Service A
greement, Transporter,
on written notice to Shipper, reserves the right, but shall not be obligated, to adjust
the MDQ
downward to no less than seventy-
five percent (75%) of the MDQ for such F
irm
Service
A
greement.
SECTION 7
TERM
Service will be provided for a negotiated term; provided, however, Transporter shall have the right
to terminate or suspend service immediately upon notice of such termination or suspension given
to a Shipper if
(i) Transporter, on a non-
discriminatory bas
is, shall also concurrently terminate or
suspend, as the case may be, all of its transportation services of the same type as that service which
was terminated or suspended, or (ii) deliveries of G
as for transportation under the Service
9 Agreement once commenced, have ceased for any period of ninety (90) consecutive days or more
and not resumed.
SECTION 8
NEW FACILITIES
8.1
Transporter shall not be required to provide any requested transportation service which
would require construction or acquisition by T
ransporter of any new facilities or expansion of
Transporter222s existing facilities. Transporter may agree to construct or acquire new facilities, or
expand
or modify existing facilities, to provide service requested by any Shipper. In such event,
Shipper a
grees to reimburse Transporter for the total incremental cost of the new facilities or
expansion of existing facilities, unless otherwise mutually agreed in writing. Transporter shall
determine method of reimbursement, either lump sum or installment.
8.2
To the extent Transporter agrees to construct or acquire any new facilities or expand
existing facilities, any such facilities shall be contracted, maintained, owned, and operated by
Transporter, except as may otherwise be mutually agreed in writing. T
he design and installation
of all facilities shall be in accordance with the specifications determined by Transporter.
SECTION 9
PRIORITY OF SERVICE AND SCHEDULING
Transport
ation services
on Transporter222s pipeline system shall be scheduled each day in the
following order and manner:
9.1
Firm
transportation
service shall receive first
priority
. Within this category, Transporter
shall schedule nominated service in accordance with the Curtailment Standards of the RCT set
forth in 16 Texas Administrative Code, Section 7.455.
Firm transportation service shall be
scheduled in descending order according to the subcategories listed below in subsections 9.1.1
through 9.1.7.
9.1.1
F
irm
deliveries to human needs customers and firm deliveries of natural gas to local
distribution systems which serve human needs customers
.
9.1.2
F
irm deliveries to electric generation facilities
.
9.1.3
F
irm deliveries to industrial and commercial users of the minimum natural gas
required to prevent physical harm and/or ensure critical safety to the plant facilities, to
plant personnel, or the publi
c when such protection cannot be achieved through the use of
an alternate fuel
.
9.1.4
F
irm deliveries to small industrials and regular commercial loads that use less than
3,000 Mcf per day.
10 9.1.5
F
irm deliveries to large industrial and commercial users f
or fuel or as a raw material
where an alternate fuel or raw material cannot be used and operation and plant production
would be curtailed or shut down completely when natural gas is curtailed.
9.1.6
F
irm deliveries to large industrial and commercial users
for fuel or as a raw material
where an alternate fuel or raw material can be used and operation and plant production
would be curtailed or shut down completely when natural gas is curtailed.
9.1.7
F
irm deliveries to customers that are not covered by the priorities listed in
subsections 9.1.1 through 9.1.6 above.
If Transporter is unable to schedule all nominations for Firm transportation service in a
subcategory above, gas will be scheduled within such subcategory on a pro rata basis based on the
quantity that would otherwise be scheduled.
9.2
Interruptible
transportation
s
ervice and Authorized Overrun s
ervice shall receive second
priority. Within this category, Transporter shall schedule nominated service on an economic basis.
As such, Transporter shall accord service paying a higher rate per
MMBtu a higher priority than
service paying a lower rate. If two or more Shippers are paying the same rate per MMBtu,
Transporter shall schedule nominated service on a pro rata basis.
9.3
Parking and Lending Service shall receive third
priority. With
in this category, Transporter
shall schedule nominated service on an economic basis. If two or more S
hippers are paying the
same rate per MMBtu, Transporter shall schedule nominated service on a pro
rata basis.
If
Transporter is unable to schedule all nomi
nations for withdrawals from parking and all
nominations for lending service, withdrawals from parking shall receive priority over lending
service.
If
Transporter is unable to schedule all nominations for repayment of loaned Gas and all
nominations for par
king service, repayment of loaned Gas shall receive priority over nominations
for parking service.
9.4
Imbalance correction quantities nominated under any Service A
greement shall receive
fourth
priority. Within this category, Transporter shall schedule nominated service on a pro rata
basis.
SECTION 10
PRE
-
DETERMINED ALLOCATIONS
10.1
Operators of Central Receipt Points and Points of Delivery shall provide to Transporter a
Pre
-
Determined Allocation (223PDA224); provided, however, such PDA must be acceptable to and
capable of being implemented by Transporter. The PDA shall be used to allocate G
as quantities
at each Central Receipt Point, Point of R
eceipt and Point of Delivery.
10.2
For meters physically behind or attributable to a Central Receipt Point(s), the meter
operators or their representative will provide the PDA at the Central Receipt Point meter.
11 10.3
All PDA222s shall be received in accordance with the nomination deadlines specified in
Section 20.
10.4
If
a PDA is not received from the operator or its representative, the PDA will default to a
pro rata allocation. Transporter may accept PDA222s received after the referenced deadlines
on a
not unduly discriminatory basis.
SECTION 11
CURTAILMENT
11.1
Transporter shall have the right to curtail or discontinue transportation service in whole or
in part on any portion of its Pipeline System at any time for reasons of force majeure as defined in
Section 21.1 or when in Transporter
determines
, capacity or operating conditions so require or it
is desirable or necessary to perform maintenance or to make modif
ications, repairs or operating
changes to its system.
11.2
Transporter shall provide Shipper such notice of the curtailment as is reasonable under the
circumstances. If curtailment of transportation service is require
d, service quantities shall be
curtai
led
, giving effect to the order of priority as set forth in Section 9.
11.3
Transporter may require Shipper to withdraw all, or any portion of the Gas quantities
parked by Transporter within thirty (30) Gas Days of Transporter222s notice to Shipper. If Shi
pper
fails to nominate for the withdrawal of the quantities specified by Transporter in its notice, despite
the availability of capacity for the withdrawal of Shipper222s Gas under its S
ervice
A
greement,
T
ransporter shall take title to that portion of Shippe
r222s parking account that Shipper was instructed
to withdraw, free and clear of any adverse claims. Transporter222s notice to Shipper may be verbal
and in such case shall be followed by a written confirmation within five (5) Business Days.
11.4
To protect an
d/or maintain the operational integrity of its Pipeline System, Transporter may
require the withdrawal of quantities of Gas in Shipper222s parking account within 24 hours of notice.
If
Shipper does not cause the withdrawal of specified quantities of Gas within 24 hours after notice,
Transporter shall have the right to take title to those quantities of Gas in Shipper222s parking account
free and clear of any adverse claims.
11.5
To protect and/or maintain the operational integrity of its Pipeline System, Transporter may
require Shipper to adjust its redelivery schedule and redeliver quantities of Gas in Shipper222s
lending account within 24 hours.
11.6
Transporter shall not be liable for any loss or damage to any person or property caused, in
whole or in part, by
any interruption or curtailment of service, except to the extent caused by
Transporter222s gross negligence or willful misconduct. Shipper agrees to indemnify and hold
harmless Transporter, its officers, agents, employees, and contractors from and against a
ny and all
suits, claims, liability, loss, damages, costs (including attorneys222 fees and court costs) or
encumbrances whatsoever brought by any person or entity against Transporter as a result of or
12 arising out of any interruption or curtailment of service
(unless caused by Transporter222s gross
negligence o
r
willful misconduct).
SECTION 12
PRESSURE
Shipper shall deliver Gas to Transporter at the specified Point(s) of Receipt at pressures sufficient
to allow the Gas to enter Transporter222s Pipeline System but shall not deliver Gas at pressures in
excess of the MAOP at such Point(s) of Receipt. Transpor
ter is under no obligation to modify its
line or to install additional facilities to permit the entry of Shipper222s Gas into its Pipeline System.
Transporter shall deliver Gas for Shipper222s account at the pressures existing from time to time in
Transporter222
s Pipeline System at the Point(s) of Delivery.
SECTION 13
TITLE AND RISK OF LOSS
13.1
Shipper warrants for itself, its successors and assigns, that it will have at the time of
delivery of Gas at the Point(s) of Receipt for Transportation, parking or lending either good title
or all rights necessary and appropriate to have the Gas transported, parked or loaned. Shipper
warrants for itself, its successors and assigns, that the Gas it delivers under
a
ny Service Agreement
shall be free and clear of all liens
, encumbrances and claims on the title to the Gas; and that it will
indemnify and hold harmless Transporter, its officers, agents, employees and contractors from and
against any and all suits, claims, liability, loss, damages, costs (including attorneys222 f
ees and court
costs) or encumbrances whatsoever arising directly or indirectly from or with respect to the title
and/or right to Gas tendered to Transporter under any Service A
greement
. Transporter warrants
that at the time of delivery to Shipper at the Po
int(s) of Delivery the Gas
delivered
under any
Service Agreement shall be free and clear of all liens, encumbrances and claims on the title to the
Gas; and that it will indemnify and hold harmless Shipper, its officers, agents, employees and
contractors ag
ainst any and all suits, claims, liability, loss, damages, costs (including attorney222s
fees and court costs) or encumbrances whatsoever arising directly or indirectly from or with respect
to the title and/or right to Gas delivered to Shipper as a result of
Transporter222s possession or
transportation, parking or lending under any Service Agreement
.
13.2
Transporter shall be deemed to be in possession of the Gas delivered by Shipper only from
the time it is received from the Shipper at the Point(s) of Receipt
for transportation, parking or
lending until it is delivered to Shipper at the Point(s) of Delivery as provided herein. During
Transporter222s possession and control of such Gas, Transporter shall be responsible for any
damages, losses, or injuries caused t
hereby unless such damages, losses or injuries arise from the
gross negligence or willful misconduct of Shipper. Shipper shall be deemed to be in possession
and control of such Gas and responsible for any damages, losses or injuries caused thereby prior
to
receipt by Transporter and after delivery by Transporter. Transporter shall have no responsibility
with respect to such Gas
before receipt from Shipper at the Point(s) of Receipt or after delivery to
Shipper at the Point(s) of Delivery. The party in posse
ssion of the Gas shall indemnify and hold
harmless the other party, its officers, agents, employees and contractors from and against any and
14 SECTION 15
QUALITY
15.1
All Gas tendered downstream of processing plants for delivery by Shipper to Transporter
under any Service Agreement must meet the following quality specifications at the Point(s) of
Receipt. For Gas tendered upstream of a processin
g plant, the quality specifications shall be those
required by the processing facility.
15.1.1
Such Gas must not contain more than one
-
quarter (1/4) of one (1) grain of hydrogen
sulfide or more than five (5) grains of sulfur per one hundred (100) cubic fe
et;
15.1.2
Such Gas must have a total Gross Heating Value of not less than nine hundred fifty
(950) Btus per cubic foot of Gas when saturated with H2O vapor;
Gas tendered at the
Sonora and Pecos Loop Lines must have a total Gross Heating Value of not less than one
thousand fifty (1050) Btus per cubic foot of Gas when saturated with H2O vapor;
15.1.3
Such Gas must not have a temperature greater than one hundre
d twenty (120)
degrees F or less than forty (40) degrees F;
15.1.4
Such Gas must not have a hydrocarbon dew point greater than forty (40) degrees F;
15.1.5
Such Gas must not contain more than two (2) percent by volume of carbon dioxide;
15.1.6
Such Gas must not contain more than two (2) percent by volume of nitrogen;
15.1.7
Such Gas must not contain more than two-
tenths (.2) percent by volume of oxygen;
15.1.8
Such Gas must not contain more than four hundred parts per million (400 ppm) of
hydrogen;
15.1.9
Such Gas must not contain more than four (4) percent by volume of non-
hydrocarbon gases;
15.1.10
Such Gas must be commercially free of all liquids, suspended matter, dust,
all gums and gum forming constituents, and other objectionable substances;
15.1.11
Such Gas must not contain more than seven (7) pounds of H2O vapor per
one million (1,000,000) cubic feet; and
15.1.12
Such Gas must not contain any substance in any amount which violates any
applicable laws, orders, rules, and regulations of any jurisdictional authority with
jurisdiction hereof.
15.2
Transporter shall not be obligated to accept G
as under any Service Agreement
, which does
not conform to these specifications. If
G
as received under any Service Agreement does not
conform to these quality specifications, Transporter shall notify Shipper of such nonconformance
15 and Shipper shall immediately cease delivery of G
as to Transporter or bring such G
a
s within
specification. Transporter may elect from time to time to receive such G
as not conforming to the
quality specifications herein. Transporter reserves the right to modify these quality specifications
as the quality specifications of the downstream pipelines are modified. Acceptance by either party
of
G
as that does not conform to the quality specifications stated above shall not constitute a waiver
of such quality specifications by that party in regard to G
as received or delivered under the Service
Agreement in the future, nor shall acceptance without an express written waiver constitute a waiver
of any claim for damages resulting from delivery of G
as not meeting such specifications.
15.3
Notwithstanding anything in this Statement of Operating Conditions to the contrary, if
Shipper shall deliver Gas containing any substance which harms or could harm Transporter,
Transporter222s facilities or the facilities of any third party, Transporter shall have the right t
o
immediately suspend taking such Gas and Shipper shall indemnify and hold harmless Transporter
against any claims or causes of action brought by any person or entity, whether in contract or in
tort, which arise out of or are related to the transportation,
parking or lending of such Gas and shall
reimburse Transporter for any and all damages arising therefrom.
15.4
Transporter shall have the right, but not the obligation, to designate quality specifications
in the S
ervice
A
greement at a particular Point(s) of Receipt which may vary from those stated
above, provided such Gas blends with Transporter222s Pipeline System G
as to meet the standard
quality specifications stated in Section 15.1. Transporter222s acceptance of such Gas tendered by
Shipper on a particular Gas Day does not constitute a waiver by Transporter of its right to refuse
to accept Gas not conforming to the quality specifications stated above on another Gas Day.
SECTION 16
MEASUREMENT
16.1
The unit of volume for measurement of Gas received and delivered under any Service
Agreement
is one thousand (1,000) cubic feet of Gas at a base temperature of sixty (60
) degrees F
and at an absolute pressure of fourteen and seventy-
three hundredths (14.73) Psia. The MMBtu
equivalent of such unit of volume shall be determined by multiplying each such unit of volume by
the total heating value per cubic foot of Gas under an
y Service Agreement and by dividing the
result by one thousand (1,000).
16.2
All measurement facilities that Shipper may be required to install shall be installed and
operated in accordance with the standards approved by the American National Standards Institute
on
June 28, 1977, and prescribed in the Gas Measurement Committee of the American Gas
Association (223AGA224) Report Number 3 (ANSI/API 2530-
92; API#14.3; GAP 8185-
92), as it is
now and from time to time may be revised, amended or supplemented.
16.3
T
ransporter shall arrange for the ownership and operation of the measuring stations located
at the Point(s) of Receipt and Point(s) of Delivery. The changing of charts or collection of
electronic measurement data and the calculation of the volume and energy
value (MMBtu) thereof
shall be the responsibility of the Transporter. The calibrating and adjusting of meters shall be
performed or arranged for by the Transporter in compliance with Section 16.8.
16
16.4
Shipper has the right to be present at the time of any installing, reading, cleaning, changing,
repairing, inspecting, testing, calibrating or adjusting done in connection with the equipment used
in measuring Gas. The records from such measuring equipment shall remain the property of
Transporter or its representative, but upon request, Transporter shall submit to Shipper copies of
the records and charts, together with calculations therefrom, subject to their return within thirty
(30) days after receipt ther
eof. If Shipper fails to return the records and charts within thirty (30)
days, Transporter shall be under no obligation to provide additional records and charts until the
non-
returned records and charts until the non-
returned records and charts are return
ed to
Transporter. Transporter shall retain the charts for a period of two (2) Contract Years following
the end of the Contract Year to which they are applicable. Transporter shall give Shipper sufficient
notice in advance of all tests so that Shipper may,
at its election, be present in person or by its
representative to observe adjustments, if any, which are made.
16.5
For the purposes of measurement and meter calibration, the atmospheric (barometric)
pressure shall be assumed, unless otherwise determine
d by the Standard Gas Measurement Law,
to be constant, determined by elevation and specific site location irrespective of variations in actual
atmospheric pressure from time to time.
16.6
The temperature of the Gas shall be determined by the continuous us
e of a recording
thermometer. The temperature recorded each Gas Day, during periods of flow only, shall be used
in computing the Gas volume for that Gas Day.
16.7
At Transporter
222s option, Btu and relative density may be determined by means of an on-
line c
hromatograph, a portable chromatograph, a continuous sample, or a spot sample taken at the
Point(s) of Receipt and Point(s) of Delivery.
If
a continuous or spot sample is utilized, the results
of the analysis of such sample may be applied to Gas delivered on the first Gas Day of the following
Month and thereafter until the first Gas Day of the Month following in which another sample is
taken. For the Month in which Gas first flows, the results of the analysis of such continuous spot
sample shall also be used in calculating quantities of Gas with ANSI/ASTM D3588-
79 as is now
in effect and from time to time may be amended, revised or updated.
16.8
If, upon any test, the metering equipment at any point is found to be inaccurate in the
aggregate by one (1) percent or more, registration thereof and any payment based upon such
registrations shall be corrected at the rate of such inaccuracy for any period of inaccuracy which
is definitely known or agreed upon, or if not known or agreed upon, then for a period e
xtending
back one
-
half (1/2) of the time elapsed since the Gas Day last calibrated not to exceed fifteen (15)
Gas Days. Following any test, any metering equipment found to be inaccurate to any degree shall
be adjusted immediately to measure accurately. If,
for any reason, any meter is out of service or
out of repair so that the quantity of Gas delivered or redelivered through such meter cannot be
ascertained or computed from the readings thereof, the quantity of Gas so delivered during the
period such meter
is out of service or out of repair shall be estimated and agreed upon by the parties
hereto on the basis of the best available data, using the first of the following methods that is
feasible:
17 16.8.1
By using the registration of any check measuring equipm
ent of the other party,
installed and registering; or
16.8.2
By correcting the error if the percentage of error is ascertainable by calibration, test
or mathematical calculation; or
16.8.3
By estimating the quantity of receipts or deliveries from precedi
ng periods under
similar conditions when the meter was registering accurately.
SECTION 17
BALANCING
17.1
If Shipper is in compliance with all of its obligations under a Service Agreement
,
Transporter will deliver to Shipper or its designee at the Point
(s) of Delivery on a daily basis
quantities
T
hermally
E
quivalent to quantities received, less Fuel and Lost and Unaccounted For,
if applicable, unless otherwise mutually agreed to in writing. Transporter, upon notice to Shipper
may issue
an
223Operational Flow Order224
(
223
OFO224
)
to require adjustments to Shipper222s daily
scheduling of receipts and/or deliveries over a reasonable period of time in order to maintain a
concurrent balance when the operational integrity and/or safe operation of Transport
er222s
P
ipeline
S
ystem would otherwise be threatened or result in inefficient or unreliable service. If Shipper does
not comply with an OFO
then Transporter may assess a penalty for those volumes that flowed in
violation of the OFO
. The OFO penalty will equ
al the higher of $25/MMBtu or two (2) times the
highest Gas Daily
Katy or Waha midpoint during the M
onth in which the OFO was declared.
17.2
If Shipper is advised by any upstream or downstream transporter or operator to reduce or
suspend deliveries for tr
ansportation, Shipper shall immediately notify Transporter orally, and
shall confirm such notification in writing, of such reduction or suspension, and adjust its
nominations at Point(s) of Receipt and/or Point(s) of Delivery in order to maintain a balance
d
position.
17.3
Shipper shall be responsible for and shall bear any penalties imposed, claims made, or
judgments (collectively called 223Liability224) imposed by either (a) upstream and downstream
transporters for imbalances between Point(s) of Receipt and Point(s) of Delivery or (b) well
operators or well interest owners for production imbalances among the interest owners in a well.
Shipper shall indemnify and hold Transporter harmless from all such Liability, including court
costs and reasonab
le attorney fees, unless such Liability is found to be the direct result of
Transporter222s negligence.
17.4
Prior to initiating corrective action, absent conditions threatening Transporter222s system
integrity or safe operations, Transporter will provide to Shipper information regarding any
imbalance situation that has occurred or may occur unless corrective action is taken, and Shipper
shall adjust nominations at Point(s) of Receipt and/or Point(s) of Delivery in order to maintain a
balanced position. If Shipper believes such information is inaccurate, it shall immediately provide
Transporter the information it believes to be contrary to Transporter222s conclusion for verification
prior to corrective action.

19.1
The maximum charge for transportation service pursuant to Section 311(a)(2) of the NGPA
are
the maximum rate
(s)
approved by the FERC for transportation by Transporter under Section
311(a)(2) of the NGPA
.
The
rate(s)
to be charged for such
transportation may be discounted from
the maximum rate(s), as set forth in the Service Agreement and agreed upon by

Transporter222s maximum rate
(s)
for transportation service pursuant to Section 311(a)(2) of

SECTION 20
NOMINATIONS
20.1.
If Shipper desires service under its Service Agreement on any day, Shipper shall give
written notice of Shipper222s nomination to Transporter specifying the quantity of Gas Shipper
requests under each of Shipper222s Service Agreements for each day of the servi
ce Month. Such
nomination should reflect the service for each Point of Receipt and each
Point of Delivery, any
imbalance correction quantities and any scheduled daily variations. Shipper shall furnish such
nomination to Transporter by facsimile or other e
lectronic means and such nomination shall also
specify such information as Transporter determines is necessary in order to perform the service
requested by Shipper. Receipts and deliveries of Gas herewith shall be at uniform hourly rates of
flow unless ot
herwise mutually agreed by Shipper and Transporter.
20.2.
For Transporter to be required to accept a Shipper222s initial wellhead nomination for the
first (1st) day of the service Month, Shipper222s nomination must be received by Transporter by 1:00
p.m.
Cent
ral Clock Time on the fourth (4th) Business Day prior to the last day of the Month
preceding the service Month. For Transporter to be required to accept Shipper222s nominations at
all other Points of Receipt or Delivery for the first (1st) day of the servic
e Month, Shipper222s
nominations must be received by Transporter by
1:00 p.m.
Central Clock Time on the first (1st)
Business Day prior to the last day of the Month preceding the service Month.
20.3.
Shippers shall have the right, on or after the first (1st)
day of the service Month, to submit
a new nomination or revise their existing nomination for any day during the service Month
provided such nomination is received by Transporter prior to 1:00 p.m.
Central Clock Time on the
Business Day prior to the day su
ch new or revised service is requested to commence. Such new
or revised nomination shall specify Shipper222s anticipated service requirements for the remainder
of the service Month. New or revised nominations shall be scheduled and implemented by
Transport
er on a prospective basis and only to the extent the Transporter is able to confirm the
receipt and delivery of such Gas with the operator of the Points of Receipt and Points of Delivery.
If a conflict arises between Shipper222s new or revised nomination and the operator222s confirmation,
20 Shipper understands and agrees such Point of Receipt or Delivery operator222s confirmation shall
control.
20.4
Transporter may
, on a not unduly discriminatory basis
, accept Shipper222s new or revised
nomination if such nomination is received by Transporter after 1:00 p.m.
Central Clock Time on
the Business Day prior to the day such new or revised service is requested to commence. Such
new or revised nomination shall specify Shipper222s anticipated service requirements for the
remainder of the service Month. New or revised nominations shall be scheduled and implemented
by Transporter on a prospective basis and only to the extent the Transporter is able to confirm the
receipt and delivery of such Gas with the operator of the Points of Receipt and Points of Delivery.
Such scheduling and implementation shall not 223bump224 any previously scheduled service. If a
conflict arises between Shipper222s new or revised nomination and the operator222s confirmation,
Shipper understands and agre
es such Point of Receipt or Delivery operator222s confirmation shall
control.
20.5.
All nominations will designate a person who will be responsible for coordinating notices
between Transporter, well operator(s) and operators of the Shipper222s
Points of Recei
pt and
Delivery in accordance with these procedures.
SECTION 21
FORCE MAJEURE
21.1
The term 223force majeure224 shall mean acts of God; strikes, lockouts and industrial
disturbances; conditions arising from a change in governm
e
ntal laws, orders, rules of re
gulations;
acts of public enemy;
wars; riots; civil disturbances; blockades; insurrections; epidemics;
landslides; lightning; tornadoes, hurricanes; earthquakes; fires; storms; floods; washouts;
explosions; breakage and/or accidents to ma
c
hinery or lines of pipe
;
freezing of lines of pipe; or
failure of processing facilities
and any other cause, whether of the kind enumerated herein or
otherwise,
that are
not reasonably within the control of the party claiming relief
. It is understood
and agreed that the settlement of strikes or lockouts shall be entirely within the discretion of the
party having the difficulty, and that the above requirements that any force majeure shall be
remedied with all reasonable dispatch shall not require the settlement of strikes or
lockouts when
such course is inadvisable in the discretion of the party having the difficulty. Such term shall
likewise include: (1) those instances where either Transporter or Shipper is required to obtain
servitudes, rights
-
of
-
way, grants, permits or licenses to enable such party to fulfill its obligations
under the Service Agreement; the inability of such party to acquire or the delays on the part of
such party in acquiring, at reasonable costs, and after the exercise of reasonable diligence, such
ser
vitudes, rights
-
of
-
way, grants, permits, or licenses, (2) those instances where either Transporter
or Shipper is required to furnish materials and supplies for the purpose of constructing or
maintaining facilities or is required to secure permits or permis
sions from any governmental
agency to enable such party to fulfill its obligations under the Service Agreement, the inability of
such party to acquire, or the delays on the part of such party in acquiring, at reasonable costs, and
after the exercise of reasonable diligence, such material and supplies, permits and permissions,
and (3) in those instances in which Transporter utilizes facilities of another entity or entities to
22
22.2
Lost and U
naccounted
F
or may be paid in kind at Shipper222s Point(s) of Receipt or in
dollars per MMBtu based upon an agreed upon value or actual use, as set forth in Shipper222s S
ervice
A
greement. No Lost and Unaccounted For wil
l be assessed for parking and lending service.
SECTION 23
BILLING AND PAYMENT
23.1
If not specified in the Service Agreement, Transporter shall render or cause to be rendered,
by mail, facsimile or other electronic means, to Shipper an invoice of the amount due for the
preceding
M
onth setting forth the total quantity of G
as delivered by Transporter to Shipper at the
Delivery Points and the rates for transportation service performed. Billings for quantities
transported shall be determined on a dry basis. In computing the amounts due, Transporter may
utilize estimates of the quantity of G
as received from or delivered for the account of Shipper during
a
M
onth, in place of actual quantities when actual quantities are not reasonably available; provided
that adjustments shall be made in later statements for differences between such estimated and
actual quantities. When information necessary for billing purposes is in the control of Shipper,
Shipper222s
G
as s
upplier
, or Shipper222s downstream pipeline or purchaser, Shipper shall furnish such
information to Transporter on or before the fifth (5th) day of the calendar M
onth following the
M
onth of transportation.
23.2
Within ten (10) days from date of the invoice, Shipper shall pay Transporter the invoiced
amount
described in Section 23.1. Payments to Transporter shall be made by wire transfer
credit
ing Transporter, such that funds are available to Transporter on or before the tenth (10th) day
after the date of the invoice.
23.3
Good Faith Dispute
. If a portion of an invoice is disputed, Shipper shall pay, by the date described in 23.2 above
, the p
ortion of the invoice not in dispute and shall at the same time provide
Transporter with documentation supporting its dispute. The parties shall then cooperate in good
faith to resolve such dispute as expeditiously as possible, and the portion, if any, of
such disputed
amount eventually determined to be due shall bear interest at the rate stated in Section 23.4 from
the original due date until the date actually paid.
23.4
Late Payment
. If Shipper fails to pay an invoice in full
, interest on the unpaid portion shall accrue at a rate equal to two percent (2%) above the prime rate published in the Wall Street Journal,
from time to time, or the maximum legal rate, whichever is the lesser, compounded daily from the
date such payment is due until the same is paid
; provided, however, that Shipper shall not be
required to pay interest on any amount billed which is in good faith disputed in writing by Shipper
and is ultimately determined to be in error; provided, further,
however, interes
t shall be due if such
amount billed is found not to be in error.
23.5
Transporter and Shipper shall have the right during reasonable working hours and after
execution of a confident
i
a
lity agreement to examine the books, records and charts of the other to
the extent necessary to verify the accuracy of any statements
, payment calculations or
determinations
made pursuant to the provisions contained herein. All
statement
s
, payment
s
24 at any point with G
as
which is received from or transported through any interstate pipeline
company or any intrastate pipeline company which claims exemption from the provisions of the
Natural Gas Act of 1938 pursuant to Section 1(c) thereof, or with Gas which is or may be s
old,
consumed, transported, or otherwise utilized in interstate commerce, in such a manner which will
subject the Gas
delivered by or to Shipper hereunder or any of T
ransporter
222s or its affiliate222s
pipeline, transmission, storage or related facilities, or any portions thereof, to the jurisdiction of

ever

or received from a Po
i
nt
of
Delivery
that is an interconnection between the Transporter
and the facilities of an interstate

ransporter
in the manner contemplated
in the first sentence of Section 26.1 above
,

warranted to T
ransporter
that transportation of Gas
under a Service Agreement is 223on behalf of224
an interstate pipeline company or a local distribution company served by an interstate pipeline
compa
ny and otherwise qualifies as transportation pursuant to Section 311(a)(2) of the NGPA and

ransporter

ransporter

T
ransporter

ransporter

SECTION 27
ARBITRATION
27.1
If
Transporter and Shipper are unable to resolve any dispute regarding the application or
interpretation of any provision a Service A
greem
ent or related transaction such dispute shall be
resolved through mandatory arbitration under the Rules of the Center For Public Resources
Institute For Dispute Resolution, to the extent not inconsistent with the rules specified herein.
27.2
Within twenty
(20)
B
usiness
D
ays of either Transporter222s or Shipper222s written election to
the other to arbitrate any disputes which arise under this Agreement, each party shall choose one
arbitrator, and within ten (10) Business Days after both such arbitrators are chosen, such arbitrators
shall choose a third arbitrator thus completing the whole arbitration panel. Any arbitrator chosen
shall be a disinterested party with knowledge of the industry. Any arbitration shall be conducted
in Houston, Texas
. Any transaction entered into and governed by this Statement shall be construed
in accordance with and governed by the laws of the State of Texas.
25 27.3
The arbitrator(s), once chosen, shall consider any evidence which the arbitrators deem
necessary and shall then accept s
ealed written resolutions of the subject dispute from each party
on a confidential basis to be submitted within twenty (20) Business Days of establishment of the
arbitration panel. The written submissions shall be in a form and subject to any limitations as may
be prescribed by the arbitrators. The arbitrators shall then choose only one of the proposed
solutions (without modification) as the fairest solution to the dispute within ten (10) Business Days
of receipt of the written submissions of both parties
. In the event of a three-
member arbitration
panel, a majority vote shall govern. The decision of the arbitrators shall be final and non-
appealable.
27.4
Any expenses incurred in connection with hiring the arbitrators and performing the
arbitration shall be shared and paid equally between the parties. Each party shall bear and pay its
own expenses incurred in connection with the arbitration, unless otherwi
se included in a solution
chosen by the arbitration panel.
If
either party must file a court action to enforce an arbitration
award under this Section, the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover its court costs and
reasonable attorney fees. In res
pect of any suit, action, claim or proceeding relating to a Service
Agreement, each party hereby waives, to the fullest extent permitted by law, any right to jury trial.
The existence, contents or results of any arbitration may not be disclosed without the prior written
consent of both parties. The parties submit to the non-
exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the
State of Texas
.
SECTION 28
CONFLICTS AND AUTHORITY OF STATEMENT
The rules and regulations of the FERC
govern all
transportation
services provided pursuant to
Section 311(a)(2) of the NGPA
and, if any Service Agreement
term
or provision
applicable to
NGPA Section 311 transportation service
is inconsistent the applicable FERC rules and regulations
or this Statement of Operating Conditions, the FERC222s
rules and regulations or this Statement of
Operating Conditions will control and the Service Agreement will be deemed modified
accordingly.
